alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; St. Clair; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:42PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Talladega, southwestern Calhoun and central St. Clair Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 342 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Trussville to Lincoln to Talladega. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anniston, Oxford, Talladega, Pell City, Moody, Springville, Odenville, Cobb Town, West End-Cobb Town, Saks, Lincoln, Margaret, Argo, Riverside, Ragland, Munford, Ohatchee, Hobson City, Waldo and Bald Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
